channel.title: .jar files and custom icons
channel.description:
I have googled this extensivly. I just finished a project and compiled it into a jar file. Is it possible to change the icon without having to use windows to change it? And if so, how?
I have looked all over the place and cannot find anything that gets me where I want to be. Everything just says use windows to change the shortcut, but I don't want to do that, I want to change the JAR its self. Does anyone know if this is possible?

item.title: .jar files and custom icons
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

yes but systems assign their own icons to specific applications. in windows, the only extensions that have their own icons are exe’s and various image files (and that’s on xp+).

Read full topic

item.title: .jar files and custom icons
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Coder xynt, post:1, topic:246872”][quote author=the bank link=topic=322286.msg2553407#msg2553407 date=1227745605]

Wow, lol. Thanks for all the help guys. From what I googled I assumed it was not possible. I think it’s something that sun should think about adding in later versions.

I had a program once that converts jarfiles to executables and lets you set icons etc.

While you’re at it, just destroy one of Java’s only pro’s, Multi-platform, converting it to an .exe is stupid.

[/quote]What? Those quotes don’t go together at all…you are an idiot.

It does go together. The OP is saying that sun should ‘add it in later versions’ and I quoted Yz85Racer (who had quoted magma) saying ‘While you’re at it, just destroy one of Java’s only pro’s, Multi-platform’ hinting that his post was stupid.

You’re the idiot.[/quote]Allowing different icons in jar files does not mean making them executables…

Read full topic

item.title: .jar files and custom icons
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

[quote=“qauters, post:4, topic:245812”]No, the jar file will take the icon that the program who ‘owns’ (opens) the file gives it
Incase java is the standard, then it will be a cup of coffee. In case of winrar it will be a pile of books. Incase of none, it will be an unknown file icon.[/quote]

its javaw that opens jars >.>

Read full topic

item.title: .jar files and custom icons
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

No, the jar file will take the icon that the program who ‘owns’ (opens) the file gives it
Incase java is the standard, then it will be a cup of coffee. In case of winrar it will be a pile of books. Incase of none, it will be an unknown file icon.

Read full topic
